label: interest_rate
help_text: The interest rate in investment calculations signifies the cost of capital and the potential return from an alternative investment of similar risk. It helps express the time value of money, crucial for determining the present value of future cash flows. This assists in evaluating and comparing investment opportunities. Default value of 12.3% is taken from World Bank reported average lending interest rate data of 2022. Please make sure to check this value for your project.

label: lifetime
help_text: The period during which the system will be in operation. Components whose lifetime is below that of the project lifetime must be replaced during operation, which will be taken into account in the cost calculation. In addition, the residual value of the components is determined at the end of the project lifetime.

label: n_days
help_text: Number of days used for the modelling period. For economic calculations, the project lifetime will be used.

label: very_low
help_text: Percentage of households with very low demand (0.6kWh/hh/day)

label: low
help_text: Percentage of households with low demand (1.5kWh/hh/day)

label: middle
help_text: Percentage of households with middle demand  (2.2kWh/hh/day)

label: high
help_text: Percentage of households with high demand (2.9kWh/hh/day)

label: very_high
help_text: Percentage of households with very high demand  (3.4kWh/hh/day)

label: annual_total_consumption
help_text: The demand curve will be scaled to meet the given total demand

label: annual_peak_consumption
help_text: The demand curve will be scaled to meet the given peak demand

label: distribution_cable_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component
column8: after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: distribution_cable_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: distribution_cable_max_length
help_text: Maximum allowed length of the distribution cable

label: connection_cable_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component
column8: after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: connection_cable_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: connection_cable_max_length
help_text: Maximum allowed length of the connection cable

label: pole_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component, after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: pole_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: pole_max_n_connections
help_text: Maximum number of consumers that can be connected to one pole

label: mg_connection_cost
help_text: Costs that arise when connecting a consumer in addition to the material costs of the cable.

label: include_shs
help_text: For each consumer, specific costs of grid connection are calculated and related to the consumer's consumption. If the threshold value is exceeded, a grid connection is forgone and instead a solar home system is recommended

label: shs_max_grid_cost
help_text: For each consumer, specific costs of grid connection are calculated and related to the consumer's consumption. If the threshold value is exceeded, a grid connection is forgone and instead a solar home system is recommended

label: battery_parameters_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component, after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: battery_parameters_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: battery_parameters_opex
help_text: Operating Expense (OpEx) is the cost associated with the operation of the component

label: battery_parameters_soc_min
help_text: Minimum State of Charge (SOC) of a battery refers to the lowest level at which the battery is allowed to discharge in order to prevent damage and prolong its lifespan

label: battery_parameters_soc_max
help_text: Maximum State of Charge (SOC) of a battery refers to the highest level at which the battery can be safely charged to prevent overcharging and ensure longevity

label: diesel_genset_parameters_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component, after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: diesel_genset_parameters_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: diesel_genset_parameters_opex
help_text: Operating Expense (OpEx) refers to the fixed annual costs incurred in the operation of a component, specifically excluding fuel and other variable expenses

label: inverter_parameters_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component, after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: inverter_parameters_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: inverter_parameters_opex
help_text: Operating Expense (OpEx) is the cost associated with the operation of the component

label: pv_parameters_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component, after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: pv_parameters_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: pv_parameters_opex
help_text: Operating Expense (OpEx) is the cost associated with the operation of the component

label: rectifier_parameters_lifetime
help_text: Lifespan of the component, after expiration a replacement investment must be made

label: rectifier_parameters_capex
help_text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) is the money that has to be spent to purchase the component

label: rectifier_parameters_opex
